ast.arcana-suggestions.messages.disclaim: Die Karten-Management Kritik ist noch nicht komplett fertig. Keine Empfehlungen werden im Moment ausgegeben. <0/>Die Intention dieser Sektion ist es, eine allgemeine Empfehlung der besten Praktiken zu geben. Diese Empfehlung berücksichtigt nicht, welches Gruppenmitglied besser gespielt hat oder ob dieses Mitglied in seiner Burst Phase war.
ast.arcana-suggestions.messages.explanat: Dieser Bereich verfolgt jede Karten Aktion und den Status der Verteilung nach jeder Aktion, die über den Kampf getätigt wurden.
ast.arcana-suggestions.suggestions.bardn: Barden erhalten Boni, wenn sie kritisch treffen, deswegen sollten bevorzugt sie das Ziel von Einzel-Ziel Speeren sein.
{count} Speer Arkana nicht an einen Barden abgegeben.
ast.arcana-suggestions.title: ast.arcana-suggestions.title
ast.arcana-tracking.suggestions.sleeve-d: Benutze niemals <0/>, bevor du nicht deinen <1/> Slot geleert hast. Du verlierst sonst die Möglichkeit auf eine kostenlose <2/> oder <3/>.
{0} von {sleeveUses, plural, one {# Legschema} other {# Legschema's}} wurden benutzt, obwohl bereits ein Kleine Arkana Slot gefüllt war.
ast.arcana-tracking.title: ast.arcana-tracking.title
ast.arcana-undraw-usage.macros.emptyroad: /statusoff "Expanded Royal Road"<0/>/statusoff "Enhanced Royal Road"<1/>/statusoff "Extended Royal Road"<2/>/micon "Empty Road"
ast.arcana-undraw-usage.macros.undraw: /statusoff "Bole Drawn"<0/>/statusoff "Balance Drawn"<1/>/statusoff "Arrow Drawn"<2/>/statusoff "Spear Drawn"<3/>/statusoff "Spire Drawn"<4/>/statusoff "Ewer Drawn"<5/>/micon "Undraw"
ast.arcana-undraw-usage.macros.undrawspr: /statusoff "Arrow Held"<0/>/statusoff "Balance Held"<1/>/statusoff "Spire Held"<2/>/statusoff "Bole Held"<3/>/statusoff "Ewer Held"<4/>/statusoff "Spear Held"<5/>/micon "Undraw Spread"
ast.arcana-undraw-usage.suggestions.cont: <0>Avoid using the Arcana Removal actions.</0> (<1/>) (<2/>) (<3/>) <4/>They take up an unnecessary oGCD slot. Instead, try clicking off the relevant buffs or try using macros.
ast.arcana-undraw-usage.suggestions.why: {0} instances of using an ogcd Arcana undraw action.
ast.buff-extensions.messages.buffs-exten: {numBuffs, plural, one {# buff} other {# buffs}} extended
ast.buff-extensions.messages.explanation: This section displays a history of targets affected with <0/> and <1/>.<2/>* Excluded statuses: <3/>
ast.buff-extensions.messages.targets-aff: {numTargets, plural, one {# target} other {# targets}} affected
ast.buff-extensions.title: ast.buff-extensions.title
ast.dots.requirement.uptime.name: Gesamtanwendungszeit von <0/>
ast.dots.rule.description: Obwohl Astrologen nur einen DoT besitzen, bewirkt dieser einen guten Anteil deines Schadens. Die Wirkdauer von 30 Sekunden passt zu der Abklingzeit von (<0/>), womit du Zeit hast deine Karten zu managen. Er ermöglicht es dir außerdem, dich frei bewegen zu können, ohne deine Gesamtanwendungszeit deiner GCDs zu verringern. Versuche diesen DoT permanent aufrecht zu erhalten.
ast.dots.rule.name: Halte deinen DoT aufrecht
ast.dots.suggestion.clip.content: Vermeide es <0/> zu erneuern, bevor der vorherige abgelaufen ist.
ast.dots.suggestion.clip.why: {0} von {1} durch zu frühes Reaktivieren verloren.
ast.draw.checklist.description: Draw is the main mechanic of the Astrologian, so aim to use it as many times as possible.
ast.draw.checklist.name: Benutze Ziehen regelmäßig
ast.draw.checklist.requirement.name: <0/> Nutzungen
ast.draw.suggestions.cards.content: Es ist selten sinnvoll Karten zu lange zu behalten. Du verzögerst damit dein nächstes Ziehen, wodurch du eventuell sogar mehrere Ausführungen von Ziehen, im Kampf verlieren könntest. Versuche immer so schnell wie möglich deinen Kartenslot zu leeren, außer wenn bereits eine andere Karte auf dem Ziel aktiv ist.
ast.draw.suggestions.cards.why: {drawUsesMissedFromCardsRounded, plural, one {# Ziehen} other {# Ziehen}} verloren.
ast.draw.title: ast.draw.title
ast.earthly-star.suggestion.uncooked.con: Plan your <0/> placements so that it's always cooked enough for the full potency when you need it.
ast.earthly-star.suggestion.uncooked.why: {earlyBurstCount, plural, one {# detonation} other {# detonations}} of an uncooked Earthly Star.
ast.earthly-star.title: ast.earthly-star.title
ast.lightspeed.messages.explanation: Some of the applications of <0/> include MP savings on heavy healing segments, keeping casts up while on the move and for weaving OGCDs. To further complicate usage, <1/> can reduce the cooldown, and the buff can be extended by <2/>.<3/><4/>At this point of time it's difficult to identify what is optimal, since each fight calls for a different strategy.
ast.lightspeed.title: ast.lightspeed.title
ast.lucid-dreaming.checklist.content: Wegen den hohen Mana Kosten ihrer Heilzauber, haben Astrologen einen sehr kleinen Mana Pool. Wenn sie sich an die "Immer zaubern" Regel halten, haben sie oft wenig Mana. Deswegen ist es wichtig alle Klarträume mit <0/> zu verlängern, damit man die Mana Regeneration maximiert.
ast.lucid-dreaming.checklist.name: Klartraum verlängert
ast.lucid-dreaming.suggestion.content: Keep <0/> on cooldown for better MP management, unless there's a specific part of the fight you need to drop aggro quick.
ast.lucid-dreaming.suggestion.why: About {_usesMissed, plural, one {# use} other {# uses}} of Lucid Dreaming were missed by holding it for at least a total of {0}.
ast.sleeve-draw.checklist.description: More Sleeve Draw uses mean more cards, and we want as many of those as possible.
ast.sleeve-draw.checklist.name: Benutze häufig Legschema
ast.sleeve-draw.suggestions.draw.content: Wenn du <0/> benutzt, wird die Abklingzeit von <1/> zurückgesetzt, deswegen benutzt man Legeschema direkt nachdem man Ziehen verwendet hat, damit man so viele Karten wie möglich verwenden kann.
ast.sleeve-draw.suggestions.draw.why: {drawUsesMissedFromSleeveRounded, plural, one {# Draw} other {# Draws}} lost by having their cooldowns reset by Sleeve Draw.
ast.sleeve-draw.title: ast.sleeve-draw.title
blm.about.description.warning: Das hier ist nicht mal ansatzweise fertig.
blm.gauge.suggestions.dropped-enochian.c: Den <0/> Buff fallen zu lassen führt zu verlorenen <1/>, mehr clipping durch weitere Verwendungen von <2/>, nicht verfügbar sein von <3/> und <4/>, oder einfach das Fehlen des 10% Schadensbonus, den <5/> gibt.
blm.gauge.suggestions.lost-foul.content: You lost <0/> due to dropped <1/>. <2/> is your strongest GCD, so always maximize its casts.
blm.gauge.suggestions.lost-foul.why: {0, plural, one {# Moder wurde} other {# Moder wurden}} verloren.
blm.gauge.suggestions.overwritten-foul.c: Du hast <0/> überschrieben, weil du es 30s nicht benutzt hast. <1/> ist dein stärkster GCD. Du solltest es so oft wie möglich benutzen.
blm.gauge.suggestions.overwritten-foul.w: Moder wurde {0, plural, one {# mal} other {# mal}} überschrieben.
blm.gauge.title: Job-Balken
blm.leylines.checklist: Versuche deine Ley-Linien nicht zu verlassen nachdem du sie platziert hast. Nutze die Größe der Ley-Linien aus um AOEs auszuweichen und in Reichweite der Heiler zu sein. Falls du nicht den Großteil der Dauer von Ley-Linien in ihnen bleiben kannst, erwäge sie an einer anderen Stelle im Kampf zu benutzen.
blm.leylines.title: Ley-Linien
blm.ogcd-downtime.ogcd-cd-buffer: Um zufällige Störfaktoren zu berücksichtigen wird ein Puffer von {0} Sekunden pro Instanz für deine Abklingzeiten gegeben.
blm.ogcd-downtime.ogcd-cd-metric: Stelle immer sicher, dass du deine OGCDs verwendest, wenn sie bereit sind, aber clippe sie nicht. Verwende deine Procs oder schnelle Feuga oder Eisga um sie zu weaven. {0}
blm.ogcd-downtime.title: oGCDs
blm.procs.suggestions.dropped-f3ps.conte: Du hast mindestens ein <0/> Proc verloren, da du <1/> auslaufen gelassen hast, ohne es zu verwenden.
blm.procs.suggestions.dropped-f3ps.why: {0, plural, one {# Verbessertes Feuer Proc} other {# Verbessertes Feuer Procs}} ausgelaufen.
blm.procs.suggestions.dropped-t3ps.conte: Du hast mindestens ein <0/> Proc verloren, da du <1/> auslaufen gelassen hast, ohne es zu verwenden.
blm.procs.suggestions.dropped-t3ps.why: {0, plural, one {# Thundercloud proc} other {# Thundercloud procs}} expired.
blm.rotation-watchdog.accordion.message: Der Kern von Schwarzmagiern besteht aus 6 <0/> pro Rotation (8 mit <1/>, 5 wenn <2/> übersprungen wird).<3/> Vermeide Feuga Aktivierungen zu verlieren, wenn möglich.
blm.rotation-watchdog.suggestions.extra-: Das benutzen von mehr als einem <0/> pro Lichtfeuer Zyklus ist eine Hilfestellung die durch besseres Vorrausplanen des Kampfes vermieden werden sollte.
{0, plural, one {# Feuer} other {# Feuer}} wurde benutzt.
blm.rotation-watchdog.suggestions.f4-los: Schatteneis mit einem nicht-Proc <0/> zu beenden, hat dich tatsächlich eine Aktivierung von <1/> gekostet.
Schatteneis mit Blitzga zu beenden hat dich {0, plural, one {# Feuka} other {# Feuka}} gekostet.
blm.rotation-watchdog.suggestions.icemag: Avoid spending significant amounts of time in Umbral Ice. The majority of your damage comes from your Astral Fire phase, so you should maximize the number of <0/>s cast during the fight.
{0, plural, one {# rotations} other {# rotations}} were performed with no fire spells.
blm.rotation-watchdog.suggestions.missed: Du hast mindestens ein <0/> verloren, weil du <1/> nicht übersprungen hast, bevor der Kampf vorbei war.
{0, plural, one {# Feuka} other {# Feuka}} nicht gemacht.
blm.rotation-watchdog.suggestions.ui-end: Vermeide es, Schatteneis mit einem Nicht-Proc <0/> zu beenden. Das kann zu MP Problemen und weniger <1/> Aktivierungen unter Lichtfeuer führen.
{0} Schatteneis {1, plural, one {Phase wurde} other {Phasen wurden}} mit Blitzra beendet.
blm.rotation-watchdog.suggestions.wrong-: Benutze nie ein normal gezaubertes <0/> mit in deiner Lichtfeuer-Phase, da dies MP kostet, welches du für mehr <1/> einsetzen könntest.
{0, plural, one {# Blitzra} other {# Blitzras}} wurden unter Lichtfeuer normal gezaubert.
blm.rotation-watchdog.title: Probleme mit der Rotation
blm.triple.title: Tripelzauber
core.about.patch-unsupported.description: Dieser Log wurde während Patch {0} aufgezeichnet, welcher nicht vom Analysator unterstützt wird. Berechnungen und Vorschläge könnten durch eventuelle Spieländerungen nicht korrekt sein.
core.about.patch-unsupported.title: Nicht unterstützten Patch melden
core.about.title: Über die Analyse
core.about.unsupported.description: Die unten angezeigte Ausgabe beinhaltet keine Berufsspezifische Analyse, außerdem könnten wichtige Daten nicht vorhanden sein, um ein präzises Ergebnis zu erzeugen.
core.about.unsupported.title: Dieser Job wird derzeit nicht unterstützt
core.always-cast.description: Versuche, immer etwas zu tun. Es ist oft besser kleine Fehler zu machen und die globale Abklingzeit aufrecht zu erhalten, als die richtige Rotation langsam auszuführen.
core.always-cast.title: Verwende eine Fertigkeit zu jeder Zeit
core.broken-log.broken-log.description: Ein oder mehrere Module haben gemeldet, dass dieser Log Unstimmigkeiten enthält, was darauf schließen lässt, das Daten beschädigt oder inkorrekt sind. Das System wird versuchen, vernünftige Ergebnisse darzustellen, jedoch könnten diese Inakkurat sein.
core.broken-log.broken-log.title: Dieser Log ist fehlerhaft.
core.broken-log.title: core.broken-log.title
core.changelog.title: core.changelog.title
core.checklist.title: Checkliste
core.combos.content: Avoid misusing your combo GCDs at the wrong combo step or breaking existing combos with non-combo GCDs. Breaking combos can cost you significant amounts DPS as well as important secondary effects.
core.combos.why: {0, plural, one {Du hast # Kombo Aktion fehlerhaft benutzt.} other {Du hast # Kombo Aktionen fehlerhaft benutzt.}}
core.cooldowndowntime.ogcd-cd-buffer: Um zufällige Störfaktoren zu berücksichtigen wird ein Puffer von {0} Sekunden pro Instanz für deine Abklingzeiten gegeben.
core.cooldowndowntime.ogcd-cd-metric: Stelle sicher, deine Fähigkeiten außerhalb der globalen Abklingzeit sobald wie möglich einzusetzen, ohne dabei in der Animation gefangen zu sein. {0}
core.cooldowndowntime.title: Cooldown Downtime
core.cooldowndowntime.use-ogcd-cds: Verwende deine Fähigkeiten außerhalb der globaler Abklingzeit
core.deaths.content: Sterbe nicht. Ob untätige Zeit, verlorene Job-Balken und Ressourcen oder Wiederbelebungsstatus, Tode sind absolut <0>vernichtend</0> zum Schadensausstoß.
core.error.generic: Sieht aus, als ob etwas falsch gelaufen ist. Unser hoch motiviertes Team von Programmierern wurde benachrichtigt.
core.find.job-unsupported.description: Wir sind immer danach bestrebt unsere Genauigkeit und Jobrepertoire zu verbessern. Schau doch in unserem Discord-Kanal vorbei, sicherlich kannst du uns aushelfen!
core.find.job-unsupported.title: Lieblingsjob nicht unterstützt?
core.gcd.invalid-gcd: Die geschätzte globale Abklingzeit fällt aus den möglichen Zeiträumen heraus und wurde auf {0} gesetzt.
core.gcd.no-statistics: Leider sind Spielerstatistiken nicht von FF Logs einsehbar. Daher ist die globale Abklingzeit eine <0>Abschätzung</0> und kann durchaus von der tatsächlichen Zeit abweichen. Wenn die Abschätzung <1>länger</1> als die tatsächliche Zeit ist, solltest du sehr wahrscheinlich darauf achten, deine globale Abklingzeit auszunutzen.
core.gcd.title: Globale Abklingzeit
core.home.about.title: Über xivanalysis
core.home.paste-url: Füge deine Log URL ein um anzufangen
core.potions.content: Es sieht so aus, als ob du einen Trank von bevor "Stormblood" benutzt hast. Eröffnungen und Rotationen nehmen normalerweise an, dass Aufgüsse verwendet werden, denn sie wirken <0>doppelt</0> so lange. Es ist wahrscheinlich, dass die kürzere Wirkzeit dazu führt, dass wichtige Fertigkeiten nicht mehr die Schadensverstärkung erhalten haben.
core.potions.title: Tränke
core.potions.why: Du hast einen Trank mit einer kürzeren Wirkungszeit anstelle eines Aufgusses verwendet.
core.suggestion.nothing-but-minor: Du kannst die kleineren Verbesserungsvorschläge sehen, indem du den Button "Zeige kleinere" oben rechts drückst.
core.suggestions.title: Verbesserungsvorschläge
core.timeline.help-text: Scroll or click+drag to pan, ctrl+scroll or pinch to zoom.
core.timeline.title: Zeitachse
core.weaving.content:
Vermeide mehr Aktionen zu machen, als die globale Abklingzeit zulässt. Du verzögerst dadurch deine nächste globale Abklingzeit und verlierst wertvolle "Uptime???". 
Prüfe das <0>{0}</0> Modul unten, um eine genauere Analyse zu bekommen.
core.weaving.title: Weaving
core.weaving.why: {0, plural, =1 {# Beispiel für falsches Weaving} other {# Beispiele für falsches Weaving}}
drg.about.description: <0>This analyzer aims to help you beat the sterotypes, stay off the floor, and dish out some big juicy numbers. As the DRG rotation is pretty strict, the suggestions you see will focus mostly on keeping that rotation flowing smoothly, as well as picking out issues related to your Life of the Dragon windows.</0>
drg.about.description.warning: <0>The module is a work in progress.</0> It currently covers very few aspects of DRG gameplay, and while the analysis below should be reasonably accurate, this system <1>is</1> still in development, and may get a little mixed up sometimes. If you notice any issues, or have any concerns, please drop by our Discord channel or report a bug on our github repository!
drg.blood.checklist.description: <0/> is at the heart of the DRG rotation and should be kept up at all times. Without it, your jumps are weakened and you can't use <1/>.
drg.blood.checklist.description.warning: As Blood of the Dragon is now a gauge instead of a buff, please bear in mind that the numbers here and in the Life of the Dragon windows below are simulated. As such, it may not line up perfectly with reality.
drg.blood.checklist.name: Keep Blood of the Dragon up
drg.blood.checklist.requirement.name: <0/> uptime
drg.blood.nastrond.hits: {0} long, {1, plural, one {# Nastrond} other {# Nastronds}}
drg.blood.nastrond.preface: Each of the bullets below represents a Life of the Dragon window, indicating when it started, how long it lasted, and how many casts of <0/> it contained. Ideally, each window should be at least 24 seconds long and contain 3 Nastronds.
drg.blood.suggestions.eyes.content: Avoid using <0/> when you already have {MAX_EYES} Eyes. Wasting Eyes will delay your Life of the Dragon windows and potentially cost you a lot of DPS.
drg.blood.suggestions.eyes.why: You used Mirage Dive {0, plural, one {# time} other {# times}} when you already had {MAX_EYES} Eyes.
drg.blood.title: drg.blood.title
drg.buffs.accordion.message: Each of your <0/> and <1/> windows should ideally contain {BUFF_GCD_TARGET} GCDs at minimum. In an optimal situation, you should be able to fit {0}, but depending on ping and skill speed, it may require the aid of party speed buffs like <2/> or <3/>. Each buff window below indicates how many GCDs it contained and will display all the casts in the window if expanded.
drg.buffs.checklist.description: <0/> provides a 10% boost to your personal damage and should always be kept up.
drg.buffs.checklist.name: Halte {0} aufrecht
drg.buffs.checklist.requirement.name: <0/> Gesamtanwendungszeit
drg.buffs.suggestions.bad-bfbs.content: Avoid using <0/> immediately before any GCD other than <1/>, <2/>, and <3/> in order to get the most possible damage out of each window.
drg.buffs.suggestions.bad-bfbs.why: {badlyTimedBfbs} of your Blood for Blood windows started on a non-optimal GCD.
drg.buffs.suggestions.life-surge.content: Avoid using <0/> on any GCD that isn't <1/> or a 5th combo hit. Any other combo action will have significantly less potency, losing a lot of the benefit of the guaranteed crit.
drg.buffs.suggestions.life-surge.why: You used {0} on a non-optimal GCD {1, plural, one {# time} other {# times}}.
drg.buffs.title: drg.buffs.title
drg.debuffs.checklist.description: <0/> and <1/> provide an important piercing vulnerability debuff and a potent DoT respectively, both of which should be maintained at all times.
drg.debuffs.checklist.name: Keep your debuffs up
drg.debuffs.suggestions.clipping.content: Avoid refreshing <0/> significantly before its expiration, as it usually indicates rotational errors. DRG's strict 11-GCD rotation should have you refreshing Chaos Thrust with 1-2 seconds remaining, depending on your skill speed.
drg.debuffs.suggestions.clipping.why: You lost {0} of Chaos Thrust to early refreshes.
drg.procs.suggestions.extenders.content: Avoid interrupting your combos at the <0/> and <1/> stages, as it causes you to lose the procs that allow you to cast them, costing you both the cast and the <2/> duration that comes with it.
drg.procs.suggestions.extenders.why: You dropped {droppedFang, plural, one {# Fang and Claw proc} other {# Fang and Claw procs}} and {droppedWheeling, plural, one {# Wheeling Thrust proc} other {# Wheeling Thrust procs}}.
drg.procs.suggestions.mirage-dropped.con: Avoid letting your <0/> procs fall off, as it can delay your Life of the Dragon windows and potentially cost you a lot of DPS.
drg.procs.suggestions.mirage-dropped.why: You dropped {droppedMirage, plural, one {# Mirage Dive proc} other {# Mirage Dive procs}}.
drg.procs.suggestions.mirage-overwritten: Avoid casting <0/> and <1/> when you already have a <2/> procs, as it overwrites them and can delay your Life of the Dragon windows and potentially cost you a lot of DPS.
You overwrote {0, plural, one {# Mirage Dive proc} other {# Mirage Dive procs}}.
drg.rotation.accordion.message: DRG has a very strict 11-GCD rotation with only minor permissable variations if you refresh <0/> early or are maintaining your DoT on two targets. All the entries below are instances of incorrect rotations.
drg.rotation.title: drg.rotation.title
glossary.proc.title: glossary.proc.title
mch.about.description: <0>This module aims to help you improve your MCH gameplay by analyzing things that are difficult to spot in raw logs and pointing out ways to tighten up your rotation, better manage procs, and get the most out of your Wildfire burst windows.</0>
mch.about.description.warning: <0>The module is a work in progress.</0> It currently covers very few aspects of MCH gameplay, and while the existing features below should be reasonably accurate, this system <1>is</1> still in development, and may get a little mixed up sometimes. If you notice any issues or have any concerns/feature requests, please drop by our Discord channel or report a bug on our github repository!
mch.ammo.suggestions.bad-use.content: Avoid using ammo on abilities like <0/> and <1/>, as they only get a potency benefit. Your ammo is best spent on <2/> and <3/> for the guaranteed procs.
mch.ammo.suggestions.bad-use.why: You used {totalBadAmmoUses} ammo on non-optimal GCDs.
mch.ammo.suggestions.waste.content: Avoid using <0/> and <1/> if they would put you over capacity. Wasting ammo costs you potency and guaranteed procs.
mch.heat.accordion.message: Every overheat window should ideally include <0/>, <1/>, and {OVERHEAT_GCD_TARGET} GCDs ({0} is also fine if you play with high ping). Each overheat window below indicates how many GCDs it contained and will display all the casts in the window if expanded.
mch.heat.suggestions.cooldown-lockout.co: Avoid using <0/> while your barrel is cooling after an overheat window, as it has the second lowest potency of your single-target weaponskills when your heat gauge is below 50.
mch.heat.suggestions.cooldown-lockout.wh: You cast Cooldown {0, plural, one {# time} other {# times}} while your barrel was cooling.
mch.heat.suggestions.cooldown.content: Avoid using <0/> if it would bring you below {HEATED_POINT} heat. Dipping too low will cost you heated shots and may delay overheat windows, throwing off your rotation and OGCD alignment.
mch.heat.suggestions.cooldown.why: You misused Cooldown {0, plural, one {# time} other {# times}}.
mch.heat.suggestions.downtime.content: Make sure to use <0/> as soon as it's available after overheat/cooldown windows, as you can't build up heat without it.
mch.heat.title: mch.heat.title
mch.hotshot.checklist.description: <0/> gibt einen 10% Boost für deinen eigenen Schaden und sollte immer benutzt werden.
mch.hotshot.checklist.name: Keep Hot Shot up
mch.hotshot.checklist.requirement.name: <0/> uptime
mch.hotshot.suggestions.refresh.content: Avoid refreshing <0/> outside of your post-overheat cooling windows unless absolutely necessary. It's your lowest potency GCD, so it suffers the least from the loss of <1/> during those windows.
mch.hotshot.suggestions.refresh.why: You refreshed Hot Shot {0, plural, one {# time} other {# times}} outside of your cooling windows.
mch.procs.suggestions.dropped.content: Avoid letting your <0/> and <1/> procs to fall off whenever possible, as they're worth a significant amount of potency.
mch.procs.suggestions.dropped.why: You let {0, plural, one {# proc} other {# procs}} fall off.
mch.procs.suggestions.missing.content: Avoid using <0/> and <1/> when you don't have procs for them, as they do less damage than any of your other GCDs without procs.
mch.procs.suggestions.missing.why: You used {0, plural, one {# action} other {# actions}} without a proc.
mch.procs.suggestions.overwritten.conten: Avoid using <0/> and <1/> when you already have the procs they produce active, particularly if it expends ammo. It's always better to spend the proc first.
mch.procs.suggestions.overwritten.why: You overwrote {0, plural, one {# proc} other {# procs}}.
mch.turrets.suggestions.no-turret.conten: Turrets provide a significant portion of a MCH's passive damage and are required to use <0/>. Make sure you resummon your turret immediately after <1/> wears off or if it dies to AoEs.
mch.turrets.suggestions.no-turret.why: No turret was active for {turretDowntime}% of the fight.
mch.turrets.title: mch.turrets.title
mch.wildfire.accordion.message: Every <0/> window should ideally contain at least {WILDFIRE_GCD_TARGET} GCDs and as many OGCDs as you can weave. Each Wildfire window below indicates how many GCDs it contained and the total damage it hit for, and will display all the damaging casts in the window if expanded.
mch.wildfire.suggestions.cooldown.conten: Try to align your <0/> windows as closely as possible with your overheat windows to maximize damage. Casting Wildfire too early or too late can cost you significant damage gains from heated shots and the 20% damage buff from overheating.
mch.wildfire.suggestions.cooldown.why: {badWildfires} of your Wildfire windows contained at least {NON_OVERHEATED_GCD_THRESHOLD} non-overheated GCDs.
mch.wildfire.suggestions.fizzle.content: Be careful to time your <0/> windows so that the damage resolves during uptime. Wildfire makes up a significant portion of your overall damage, so losing the final burst can cost you a lot.
mch.wildfire.suggestions.fizzle.why: {fizzledWildfires} of your Wildfire windows resolved for 0 damage.
mch.wildfire.title: mch.wildfire.title
mnk.about.description.warning: <0>The module is still a work in progress</0> and may occasionally give you bad feedback. If you notice any issues, or have any questions or feedback, please drop by our Discord channel!
mnk.aoe.suggestions.aotd.content: <0/> is only efficient when there are {AOTD_MIN_TARGETS} or more targets.
mnk.aoe.suggestions.aotd.why: <0/> used on too few targets {0, plural, one {# time} other {# times}}.
mnk.aoe.suggestions.rockbreaker.content: <0/> is only efficient when there are {ROCKBREAKER_MIN_TARGETS} or more targets.
mnk.aoe.suggestions.rockbreaker.why: <0/> used on too few targets {0, plural, one {# time} other {# times}}.
mnk.buffs.checklist.dragonkick.descripti: Dragon Kick's blunt resistance debuff should always be applied to your primary target.
mnk.buffs.checklist.dragonkick.name: Keep Dragon Kick up
mnk.buffs.checklist.twinsnakes.descripti: Twin Snakes is an easy 10% buff to your DPS across the board.
mnk.buffs.checklist.twinsnakes.name: Keep Twin Snakes up
mnk.buffs.suggestions.dragonkick.early.c: Avoid refreshing <0/> signficantly before its expiration as you're trading it for the higher damage <1/>.
mnk.buffs.suggestions.dragonkick.early.w: {0, plural, one {# rotation cycle was} other {# rotation cycles were}} interrupted by an early refresh.
mnk.buffs.suggestions.twinsnakes.early.c: Avoid refreshing <0/> signficantly before its expiration as you're losing uses of the higher potency <1/>.
mnk.buffs.suggestions.twinsnakes.early.w: {lostTruePotency} potency lost to {0, plural, one {# early refresh} other {# early refreshes}}.
mnk.demolish.checklist.description: <0/> is your strongest finisher (assuming at least 4 DoT ticks hit).
mnk.demolish.checklist.name: Keep Demolish up
mnk.demolish.checklist.requirement.name: <0/> uptime
mnk.demolish.suggestion.content: Avoid refreshing <0/> significantly before its expiration, unless it would result in a bad refresh due to <1/> recovery. Unnecessary refreshes risk overwriting buff snapshots.
mnk.demolish.suggestion.why: You lost {0} of Demolish to early refreshes.
mnk.fists.suggestions.foe.content: When using <0/>, remember to change back to <1/> as soon as possible.
mnk.fists.suggestions.foe.why: <0/> was active for {0, plural, one {# GCD} other {# GCDs}}.
mnk.fists.suggestions.fow.content: When using <0/>, remember to change back to <1/> as soon as possible.
mnk.fists.suggestions.fow.why: <0/> was active for {0, plural, one {# GCD} other {# GCDs}}.
mnk.fists.suggestions.stanceless.content: Fist buffs are one of your biggest DPS contributors, either directly with <0/> or <1/> manipulation with <2/> and <3/>.
mnk.fists.suggestions.stanceless.why: {0, plural, one {# GCD} other {# GCDs}} had no Fists buff active.
mnk.fists.title: mnk.fists.title
mnk.forms.suggestions.dropped.content: Avoid dropping Forms. You may need to use a gap closer or stay closer to the enemy to avoid your combo timing out. This usually indicates a bigger problem.
mnk.forms.suggestions.dropped.why: Form was broken {0, plural, one {# time.} other {# times.}}
mnk.forms.suggestions.formless.content: Avoid using <0/> and <1/> outside of <2/>. Their special effects only activate when in the correct form and <3/> has equal or higher potency depending on crits.
mnk.forms.suggestions.formless.why: {0, plural, one {# combo-starter was} other {# combo-starters were}}  used Formlessly, cancelling this special effects.
mnk.forms.suggestions.perfectbalance.con: Avoid using <0/> during <1/>. It does nothing and takes up a GCD you could better use for doing damage.
mnk.forms.suggestions.perfectbalance.why: {0, plural, one {GCD was} other {GCDs were}} wasted under <0/> by <1/>.
mnk.forms.suggestions.reset.content: Try not to cancel combos by using <0/>, <1/>, or <2/>.
mnk.forms.suggestions.reset.why: {0, plural, one {# combo was} other {# combos were}} reset by an Opo-Opo Form skill.
mnk.forms.suggestions.skipped.content: Avoid skipping Forms. You could be missing important buffs or refreshing <0/> by skipping.
mnk.forms.suggestions.skipped.why: {0, plural, one {# form was} other {# forms were}} skipped by Form Shift unnecessarily.
mnk.gl.checklist.description: <0/> is a huge chunk of MNK's damage, increasing your damage by 30% and attack speed by 15%.
mnk.gl.checklist.name: Keep Greased Lightning running
mnk.gl.checklist.requirement.name: <0/> uptime
mnk.gl.suggestions.dropped.content: Avoid dropping stacks except when using <0/>.
mnk.gl.suggestions.dropped.why: <0/> dropped {0, plural, one {# time} other {# times}}.
mnk.gl.suggestions.roe.missed.content: Avoid using <0/> when you won't take any damage.
mnk.gl.suggestions.roe.missed.why: <0/> was used {missedEarth, plural, one {# time} other {# times}} without triggering <1/>.
mnk.gl.suggestions.roe.wasted.content: Avoid using <0/> if your stacks won't drop.<1/> has the same defensive buff on its own, unless you need the prolonged defense of <2/>.
mnk.gl.suggestions.roe.wasted.why: <0/> was used {0, plural, one {# time} other {# times}} without preserving <1/>.
mnk.gl.suggestions.row.wasted.content: <0/> without saving stacks is a potency loss since you lose the damage buff from <1/>.
mnk.gl.suggestions.row.wasted.why: <0/> was used {0, plural, one {# time} other {# times}} without preserving <1/>.
mnk.gl.title: mnk.gl.title
mnk.ir.suggestions.elixir.content: Try to get every second <0/> inside <1/>.
mnk.ir.suggestions.elixir.why: {0, plural, one {# Elixir Field was} other {# Elixir Fields were}} missed inside of IR.
mnk.ir.suggestions.howling.why: {0, plural, one {# Howling Fist was} other {# Howling Fists were}} executed outside of IR.
mnk.ir.title: mnk.ir.title
mnk.rof.accordion.message: Every <0/> window should ideally contain {0} GCDs as your skill speed allows and as many OGCDs as you can weave.
mnk.rof.suggestions.gcd.content: Aim to hit {POSSIBLE_GCDS} GCDs into each <0/>.
mnk.rof.suggestions.gcd.why: {0, plural, one {# GCD was} other {# GCDs were}} missed during RoF.
mnk.rof.suggestions.tk.content: Try to fit a <0/> at the end of every <1/>.
mnk.rof.suggestions.tk.why: {0, plural, one {# Tornado Kick was} other {# Tornado Kicks were}} missed during RoF.
mnk.rof.title: mnk.rof.title
mnk.undesirables.suggestions.earthtackle: Avoid using <0/> as you're losing uses of the higher potency <1/>.
mnk.undesirables.suggestions.oneilm.cont: Avoid using <0/> as you're losing uses of the higher potency <1/> and <2/>.
mnk.undesirables.suggestions.oneilm.why: <0/> cost {oneIlmPunchCount, plural, one {# more potent GCD} other {# more potent GCDs}}.
mnk.undesirables.title: mnk.undesirables.title
nin.about.description: <0>Hey there, NIN friend! Are you tired of being looked down on by your MNK and BLM peers? Wish your raid team would stop using you for your Trick Attacks and appreciate you for who you really are? Well look no further! We'll help you bring yourself all the way up from <1>this</1> to <2>this</2>*!</0><3>As NIN tends to be more fluid than rotational, this module contains mostly suggestions for ways you can improve your gameplay, rather than strict checklist requirements. If you see a lot, don't panic - just tackle them one at a time.</3><4>*Results not guaranteed. Offer void where prohibited. Please don't sue us.</4>
nin.about.description.warning: While the existing features below should be reasonably accurate, this system is still in development and may get a little mixed up sometimes. If you notice any issues or have any concerns/feature requests, please drop by our Discord channel or report a bug on our github repository!
nin.duality.suggestions.misuse.content: Avoid using <0/> on any GCDs besides <1/>. The side effects of the GCD aren't duplicated, only the damage, so your highest damage combo hit is always ideal.
nin.duality.suggestions.misuse.why: You used Duality {0, plural, one {# time} other {# times}} on non-optimal GCDs.
nin.huton.checklist.description: <0/> provides you with a 15% attack speed increase and as such is a <1>huge</1> part of a NIN's personal DPS. Do your best not to let it drop, and recover it as quickly as possible if it does.
nin.huton.checklist.description.warning: As Huton is now a gauge instead of a buff, please bear in mind that this is an estimate, not an exact value. This also applies to any Huton-related suggestions below.
nin.huton.checklist.name: Keep Huton up
nin.huton.checklist.requirement.name: <0/> uptime
nin.huton.suggestions.clipping.content: Avoid using <0/> when <1/> has more than 40 seconds left on its duration. The excess time is wasted, so your other two combo finishers are typically better options.
nin.huton.suggestions.clipping.why: You clipped {0} of Huton with early Armor Crushes.
nin.huton.suggestions.futile-ac.content: Avoid using <0/> when <1/> is down, as it provides no benefit and does less DPS than your other combo finishers.
nin.huton.suggestions.futile-ac.why: You used Armor Crush {futileArmorCrushes, plural, one {# time} other {# times}} when Huton was down.
nin.kassatsu.suggestions.doton.content: Avoid using <0/> under <1/> unless using it against multiple targets that you expect to die slowly. If the targets will die in under 15 seconds, <2/> is the better AoE option.
nin.kassatsu.suggestions.doton.why: You cast Doton {0, plural, one {# time} other {# times}} under Kassatsu.
nin.kassatsu.suggestions.huton.content: Avoid using <0/> under <1/>, as it does no damage and completely wastes the guaranteed crit Kassatsu provides.
nin.kassatsu.suggestions.huton.why: You cast Huton {0, plural, one {# time} other {# times}} under Kassatsu.
nin.kassatsu.suggestions.hyoton.content: Avoid using <0/> under <1/>. Both <2/> and <3/> do significantly more damage.
nin.kassatsu.suggestions.hyoton.why: You cast Hyoton {0, plural, one {# time} other {# times}} under Kassatsu.
nin.kassatsu.suggestions.katon.content: Avoid using <0/> under <1/> unless using it against multiple targets. On single targets, it's better to use <2/> or <3/>.
nin.kassatsu.suggestions.katon.why: You cast Katon {0, plural, one {# time} other {# times}} under Kassatsu.
nin.kassatsu.suggestions.rabbit.content: Be especially careful not to flub your mudras under <0/>, as <1/> does no damage and completely wastes the guaranteed crit Kassatsu provides.
nin.kassatsu.suggestions.rabbit.why: You cast Rabbit Medium {0, plural, one {# time} other {# times}} under Kassatsu.
nin.kassatsu.suggestions.suiton.why: You cast Suiton {0, plural, one {# time} other {# times}} under Kassatsu.
nin.kassatsu.suggestions.waste.content: Be careful not to let <0/> fall off, as it wastes a guaranteed crit and means that you're delaying your Ninjutsu casts significantly.
nin.kassatsu.suggestions.waste.why: You allowed Kassatsu to fall off {0, plural, one {# time} other {# times}}.
nin.ninjutsu.suggestions.aoe-doton.conte: <0/> requires at least {DOTON_TICK_TARGET} ticks to be worthwhile in an AoE setting. Use <1/> instead against adds that will die quickly.
nin.ninjutsu.suggestions.aoe-doton.why: You cast an unoptimized Doton cast {badAoes, plural, one {# time} other {# times}}.
nin.ninjutsu.suggestions.hyoton.content: Avoid using <0/>, as it's the weakest of the mudra combinations and should typically never be used in raid content.
nin.ninjutsu.suggestions.hyoton.why: You cast Hyoton {0, plural, one {# time} other {# times}}.
nin.ninjutsu.suggestions.rabbit.content: Be careful not to flub your mudras, as using <0/> can cost you personal DPS at best and raid DPS at worst by reducing the number of <1/>s you can do during the fight.
nin.ninjutsu.suggestions.rabbit.why: You cast Rabbit Medium {0, plural, one {# time} other {# times}}.
nin.ninjutsu.suggestions.st-doton.conten: Avoid using <0/> on single targets outside of <1/>, as it does less damage than <2/> if any ticks miss and uses more mudras, resulting in more GCD clipping for no gain.
nin.ninjutsu.suggestions.st-doton.why: You cast a single-target Doton {badStds, plural, one {# time} other {# times}}.
nin.ninjutsu.suggestions.tcj-doton.conte: Avoid using <0/> under <1/> unless at least {TCJ_DOTON_TICK_TARGET} ticks will hit or you're up against multiple targets. On a single target that's about to jump or move, using the <2/> combo will do more damage even if <3/> is on cooldown.
nin.ninjutsu.suggestions.tcj-doton.why: You cast an unoptimized Doton under Ten Chi Jin {badTcjs, plural, one {# time} other {# times}}.
nin.ninki.suggestions.frog.content: Avoid using <0/> when you have one of your other spenders available (unless there are multiple targets), as it has the lowest potency of the three by a significant margin when used on only one.
nin.ninki.suggestions.frog.why: You used Hellfrog Medium {0, plural, one {# time} other {# times}} when other spenders were available.
nin.ninki.suggestions.waste.content: Avoid using <0/> when above 60 Ninki and holding your Ninki spenders when near or at cap (with a few small exceptions) in order to maximize the number of spenders you can use over the course of a fight.
nin.ninki.suggestions.waste.why: Overcapping caused you to lose {totalWaste} Ninki over the fight.
nin.shadowfang.checklist.description: <0/> is your strongest combo finisher (assuming at least 4 DoT ticks hit). In addition, it provides a slashing debuff which you, WARs, and SAMs are responsible for maintaining and should ideally never let lapse.
nin.shadowfang.checklist.name: Keep Shadow Fang up
nin.shadowfang.suggestions.clipping.cont: Avoid refreshing <0/> significantly before its expiration, unless it would otherwise cost you significant uptime. Unnecessary refreshes risk overwriting buff snapshots and reduce the number of times you can use <1/>.
nin.shadowfang.suggestions.clipping.why: You lost {0} of Shadow Fang to early refreshes.
nin.ta-positional.suggestions.missed.con: <0/> provides a huge raid buff to you and your party. Missing the positional can be crippling to raid DPS, especially if it happens more than once in a single fight.
nin.ta-positional.suggestions.missed.why: You missed the positional on Trick Attack {0, plural, one {# time} other {# times}}.
nin.ta-usage.suggestions.missed.content: Avoid holding <0/> for extended periods of time. It's typically ideal to use it as close to on cooldown as possible in order to keep it aligned with all the other raid buffs and personal burst windows, as well as maximizing the number of uses per fight.
nin.ta-usage.suggestions.missed.why: You delayed Trick Attack for a cumulative {0}, costing you {lostCasts, plural, one {# potential use} other {# potential uses}}.
nin.ta-usage.suggestions.none.content: <0/> is the single most powerful raid buff in your kit and should be used on cooldown, or as close to it as possible depending on the flow of the fight.
nin.ta-usage.suggestions.none.why: You didn't use Trick Attack once the entire fight.
nin.ta-usage.suggestions.opener.content: Avoid unconventional timings for your first <0/> of the fight in order to line it up with all the other raid and personal buffs. In most openers, Trick Attack should be weaved in after {OPTIMAL_GCD_COUNT} GCDs.
nin.ta-usage.suggestions.opener.why: Your first Trick Attack was {0, plural, one {# GCD} other {# GCDs}} into your opener.
nin.ta-window.suggestions.armor-crush.co: Avoid using <0/> during Trick Attack windows. Unless Huton would otherwise fall off, <1/> or <2/> are always preferable for the additional damage.
nin.ta-window.suggestions.armor-crush.wh: You used Armor Crush {0, plural, one {# time} other {# times}} during Trick Attack.
nin.ta-window.suggestions.dream.content: Avoid using <0/> outside of Trick Attack windows. Since they're both on 60 second cooldowns, they should always be paired to maximize DPS.
nin.ta-window.suggestions.dream.why: You used Dream Within A Dream {0, plural, one {# time} other {# times}} outside of Trick Attack.
nin.utility.suggestions.early-shade.cont: Vermeide es <0/> zu früh im Countdown zu benutzen. Idealerweise sollte der Kampf mit mindestens {0} übrig auf dem Buffs gestartet werden.
nin.utility.suggestions.early-shade.why: Shadewalker only had {0} left when the fight started, reducing its effectiveness.
nin.utility.suggestions.early-smoke.cont: Avoid using <0/> too early on the countdown. If using it pre-pull, you should ideally start the fight with at least {0} of the buff remaining.
nin.utility.suggestions.early-smoke.why: Smoke Screen only had {0} left when the fight started, reducing its effectiveness.
nin.utility.suggestions.no-shade.content: <0/> should almost always be used on the pull, as it will help your main tank solidify threat much more quickly and reduce everyone else's risk of stealing threat.
nin.utility.suggestions.no-shade.why: You didn't use Shadewalker pre-pull or within the first {0} of the fight.
nin.utility.suggestions.no-smoke.content: <0/> can be a very useful utility for your party and should be used to help mitigate the threat generated by high burst DPS or burst healing windows.
nin.utility.suggestions.no-smoke.why: You didn't use Smoke Screen pre-pull or within the first {0} of the fight.
pld.fightorflight.suggestions.circle-of-: Try to land one <0/> during every <1/> window.
{0, plural, one {# usage} other {# usages}} missed during <0/> windows.
pld.fightorflight.suggestions.gcds.conte: Try to land 10 GCDs during every <0/> window.
pld.fightorflight.suggestions.gcds.why: {0, plural, one {# GCD} other {# GCDs}} missed during <0/> windows.
pld.fightorflight.suggestions.goring-bla: Try to refresh <0/> 9 GCDs after the first <1/> in a <2/> window.
{0, plural, one {# application was} other {# applications were}} refreshed too early during <0/> windows.
Try to land 2 <0/> during every <1/> window. One at the beginning and one at the end.
{0, plural, one {# application} other {# applications}} missed during <0/> windows.
pld.fightorflight.suggestions.spirits-wi: Try to land one <0/> during every <1/> window.
{0, plural, one {# usage} other {# usages}} missed during <0/> windows.
pld.fightorflight.title: pld.fightorflight.title
pld.goring.checklist.goringblade.descrip: As a Paladin, <0/> is a significant portion of your sustained damage, and is required to kept up for as much as possible, for the best damage output.
pld.goring.suggestions.goringblade.conte: Avoid refreshing <0/> significantly before it's expiration.
pld.oath.checklist.swordoath.description: As a Paladin, <0/> is a decent chunk of your sustained damage, and should be used as much as possible, for the best damage output.
pld.requiescat.suggestions.nobuff.conten: <0/> should only be used when over 80% MP. Try to not miss on the 20% Magic Damage buff <1/> provides.
pld.requiescat.suggestions.nobuff.why: {missedRequiescatBuffs, plural, one {# usage} other {# usages}} while under 80% MP.
pld.requiescat.suggestions.wrong-gcd.con: GCDs used during <0/> should be limited to <1/> for optimal damage.
pld.requiescat.suggestions.wrong-gcd.why: {missedHolySpirits, plural, one {# missing cast} other {# missing casts}} during the <0/> buff window.
pld.requiescat.title: pld.requiescat.title
rdm.about.description: <0>This analyzer aims to give you the information you need to turn your <1>parses</1> into <2>parses</2></0><3>If you would like to learn more about RDM, check the guides over at <4>The Balance</4>, and have a chat in the <5>#rdm_questions</5> channel.</3>
rdm.about.description.warning: Openers, advanced <0/>, <1/>, and <2/> rules are currently not supported at this time.
rdm.combos.suggestions.derpcombos.conten: Be sure not to use combo actions out of order.
rdm.combos.suggestions.derpcombos.why: {derpComboCount, plural, one {# enchanted combo was lost due to using the combo skills out of order} other {# enchanted combos were lost due to using the combo skills out of order}}
rdm.combos.suggestions.notenoughmanacomb: Be sure not to enter your combo before having 80|80 mana

{notEnoughManaCount, plural, one {# enchanted combo was lost due to entering the combo before having enough mana} other {# enchanted combos were lost due to entering the combo before having enough mana}}
rdm.combos.suggestions.therestcombos.con: Do not allow your combo to timeout or use GCD Skills or Manafication during your enchanted combos
rdm.combos.suggestions.therestcombos.why: {theRest, plural, one {# enchanted combo was lost due to general combo breakage or combo timing out} other {# enchanted combos were lost due to general combo breakage or combo timing out}}
rdm.dualcast.suggestions.missed.content: You should avoid wasting DualCast procs entirely as it is lost potency overtime.
rdm.dualcast.suggestions.missed.why: {0} {1, plural, one {Dualcast was} other {Dualcasts were}} lost due to not casting.
rdm.dualcast.suggestions.wasted.content: Spells used while <0/> is up should be limited to <1/>, <2/>, or <3/>
rdm.dualcast.suggestions.wasted.why: {0} {1, plural, one {Dualcast was} other {Dualcasts were}} wasted on low cast-time spells.
rdm.dualcast.title: rdm.dualcast.title
rdm.gauge.suggestions.black-mana-lost-co: Ensure you don't allow a difference of more than 30 betwen mana types, you lost Black Mana due to Imbalance which reduces your overall mana gain and potentially costs you one or more Enchanted Combos
rdm.gauge.suggestions.black-mana-lost-wh: You lost {0} Black Mana due to overage of White Mana
rdm.gauge.suggestions.black-mana-wasted-: Ensure you don't overcap your Black Mana before a combo, overcapping Black Mana indicates your balance was off; and you potentially lost out on Enchanted Combo damage.  You should look to execute at 80/80 or as close to it as possible.
You lost {0} Black Mana due to capped Gauge resources
rdm.gauge.suggestions.wastedverflare.con: You should use <0/> over <1/> in the following situations in order of importance<2><3>When your black mana is lower</3><4>Your mana is even and you have <5/> (Use <6/> if available!)</4><7>Black mana is higher by 9 or less and <8/> is available with <9/></7></2>
rdm.gauge.suggestions.wastedverflare.why: {0, plural, one {# Verfire cast was lost due to using Verholy incorrectly} other {# Verfire casts were lost due to using Verholy incorrectly}}
rdm.gauge.suggestions.wastedverholy.cont: You should use <0/> over <1/> in the following situations in order of importance<2><3>When your white mana is lower</3><4>Your mana is even and you have <5/> (Use <6/> if available!)</4><7>White mana is higher by 9 or less and <8/> is available with <9/></7></2>
rdm.gauge.suggestions.wastedverholy.why: {0, plural, one {# Verstone cast was lost due to using Verflare incorrectly} other {# Verstone casts were lost due to using Verflare incorrectly}}
rdm.gauge.suggestions.white-mana-lost-co: Ensure you don't allow a difference of more than 30 betwen mana types, you lost white Mana due to Imbalance which reduces your overall mana gain and potentially costs you one or more Enchanted Combos
rdm.gauge.suggestions.white-mana-lost-wh: You lost {0} White Mana due to overage of black Mana
rdm.gauge.suggestions.white-mana-wasted-: Ensure you don't overcap your White Mana before a combo, overcapping White Mana indicates your balance was off; and you potentially lost out on Enchanted Combo damage.  You should look to execute at 80/80 or as close to it as possible.
You lost {0} White Mana due to capped Gauge resources
rdm.gauge.title: rdm.gauge.title
rdm.procs.invulnlist.preface: Each of the bullets below is the chronological order of procs wasted on an invulnerable boss
rdm.procs.suggestions.impact.missed.cont: Try to use <0/> whenever you have <1/> to avoid losing out on mana gains, even if you will overwrite <2/> or <3/> with your Dualcast
rdm.procs.suggestions.impact.missed.why: You missed {missedImpact, plural, one {# Impact proc} other {# Impact procs}}.
rdm.procs.suggestions.impact.overwritten: {overWrittenImpact, plural, one {# Impact proc} other {# Impact procs}} were lost due to being overwritten.
rdm.procs.suggestions.invuln.content: Try not to use <0/>, <1/>, and <2/> while the boss is invulnerable
rdm.procs.suggestions.invuln.why: You used {invulnImpact, plural, one {# Impact proc} other {# Impact procs}}, {invulnFire, plural, one {# Verfire proc} other {# Verfire procs}}, and {invulnStone, plural, one {# Verstone proc} other {# Verstone procs}} on an invulnerable boss.
rdm.procs.suggestions.missed.content: Try to use <0/> whenever you have <1/> or <2/> whenever you have <3/> to avoid losing out on mana gains
rdm.procs.suggestions.missed.why: You missed {missedFire, plural, one {# Verfire proc} other {# Verfire procs}}, and {missedStone, plural, one {# Verstone proc} other {# Verstone procs}}.
rdm.procs.suggestions.overwritten.conten: Don't cast <0/> when you have <1/> or <2/> when you have <3/>
rdm.procs.suggestions.overwritten.why: {overWrittenFire, plural, one {# Verfire proc} other {# Verfire procs}}, and {overWrittenStone, plural, one {# Verstone proc} other {# Verstone procs}} were lost due to being overwritten.  This excludes procs overwritten from a forced use of <0/>
rdm.procs.title: rdm.procs.title
smn.about.description.warning: Während die unten angegebene Analyse ziemlich akkurat ist, ist dieses Sytem immer noch in Entwicklung und wird gelegentlich Fehler machen. Wenn Sie irgendwelche Probleme oder Fehler finden oder Bedenken haben, besuchen sie bitte unseren Discord Kanal!
smn.aetherflow.checklist.description: Fähigkeiten und Spielstil des Beschwörers basieren auf der Ätherfluss Abklingzeit. Stelle sicher, dass du jeden möglichen Nutzen aus dieser Fähigkeit herraus holst.
smn.aetherflow.checklist.name: Benutze <0/> effizient
smn.aetherflow.suggestions.fester.conten: Um das größte Schadenspotenzial von <0/> zu erreichen, stelle sicher, dass du sowohl <1/> als auch <2/> an dem Ziel verursacht hast. Vermeide es Schwäre direkt nach der Verursachung eines DoTs zu benutzt, da Statuseffekte einen kurzen Zeitraum benötigen um am Ziel zu wirken.
smn.aetherflow.suggestions.fester.why: {totalFesterPotencyLost} verlorener Attacke-Wert durch {numBadFesters, plural, one {# Aktivierung} other {# Aktivierungen}} von Schwäre mit fehlenden DoTs am Ziel.
smn.aetherflow.suggestions.painflare.con: Vermeide es <0/> auf ein einzelnes Ziel zu benutzen, außer du möchtest <1/> früher aktivieren, da es weniger Schaden pro Treffer macht, als <2/>.
smn.aetherflow.suggestions.painflare.why: {numBadPainflares} {numBadPainflares, plural, one {Aktivierung} other {Aktivierungen}} von Schmerzensflare auf ein einzelnes Ziel.
smn.aetherflow.title: Ätherfluss
smn.bahamut.ghost-disclaimer: Bahamuts Fähigkeiten können "ghosten" - das heißt Fähigkeiten haben den Anschein benutzt zu werden und Schaden zu verursachen, allerdings passiert das nicht. <0>Gelb</0> werden Fähigkeiten hervorgehoben, bei denen es sehr wahrscheinlich ist, dass sie "geghosted" haben und <1>Rot<1/> für Fähigkeiten, bei denen kein Zweifel an "ghosten" besteht.<2/> Du solltest darauf achten, während jeder Bahamut-Beschwörung 11 Drachenwellen und 2 Akh Morns zu benutzen, außer du "rushed???" oder triffst mehrere Ziele.
smn.bahamut.title: Bahamut
Even if primarily using Ifrit-Egi, <0/> should be used at least once during a fight, as part of your opener.
Contagion was not cast at all during the fight.
smn.dots.checklist.description: Als Beschwörer kommt ein großteil deines dauerhaften Schadens von DoTs. Sie werden für den optimalen Schaden von <0/> benötigt, was der Hauptverbraucher deiner Stapelzahl an Ätherfluss ist. Versuche immer deine DoTs am laufen zu halten.
smn.dots.checklist.name: Halte deine DoTs aufrecht
smn.dots.suggestions.clipping.content: Vermeide es, deine DoTs deutlich vor ihrem Ablauf zu erneuern, außer während der Eröffnung oder am Ende des Kampfes. Durch unnötige Erneuerungen riskierst du "Buff Snapshots" ( => glossary stuff???) zu überschreiben und erhöhst die Anzahl an normal gezauberten DoTs.
smn.dots.suggestions.clipping.why: {0} von {1} und {2} von {3} durch zu frühes Reaktivieren verloren.
smn.dwt.suggestions.bad-gcds.content: Während Bahamut-Trance sollten sich deine GCDs auf <0/> und <1/> (oder <2/< für AoE Schaden) begrenzen.
smn.dwt.suggestions.missed-deathflares.c: Stelle sicher, dass du <0/> immer mit mit einer <1/> beendest. Andernfalls ist das ein riesiger Schadensverlust.
smn.dwt.suggestions.missed-gcds.content: Du kannst <0>{possibleGcds}</0> GCDs während jeder Aktivierung von <1/> mit deinem GCD durchführen. In der Regel solltest du Bahamut-Trance nicht vorzeitig beenden mit folgenden Ausnahmen: Der Boss wird unverwundbar, stirbt, die Abklingzeit von <2/> ist beendet oder <3/> trifft mehrere Ziele.
smn.dwt.suggestions.missed-gcds.why: {0} zusätzliche GCDs hätten während Bahamut-Trance benutzt werden können.
smn.dwt.title: Bahamut-Trance
smn.gauge.suggestions.lost-aetherflow.co: Stelle sicher, dass du volle 3 Stacks von <0/> pro Aktivierung hast. Jeder verlorene Stack ist ein starker Schadensverlust und kann deine nächste <1/> (dadurch auch Bahamut) um bis zu einer Minute nach hinten verschieben.
smn.gauge.suggestions.lost-aetherflow.wh: {0, plural, one {# Stapel} other {# Stapel}} von Ätherfluss verloren.
smn.gauge.suggestions.lost-dreadwyrm-aet: Stelle sicher, dass du immer <0/> vor deinem nächsten <1/>. Andernfalls wird Bahamut in deiner verschoben und du verlierst möglicherweise eine Beschwörung über die Dauer des Kampfes.
{0, plural, one {# Stapel} other {# Stapel}} von Bahamut-Äther verloren.
smn.pets.suggestions.no-pet.content: Egi verursachen <0> eine menge </0> des passiven Schadens eines Beschwörers und sind wesentlich für <1/> "Proc" und <2/>. Stelle sicher, dass du immer einen Egi beschworen hast und halte sie aus Boss AoEs raus.
smn.pets.suggestions.no-pet.why: No pet summoned for {noPetUptimePercent}% of the fight (<1% is recommended).
smn.pets.suggestions.prefer-garuda.conte: Wenn mehr magische Fernkämpfer als du selbst in der Party sind, solltest du hauptsächlich das Garuda-Egi benutzen. Sie profitieren von <0/> magischer Verwundbarkeit.
smn.pets.suggestions.prefer-ifrit.conten: Wenn keine anderen magische Fernkämpfer als du selbst in der Party sind, solltest du hauptsächlich das Ifrit-Egi benutzen. Ifrits selber und <0/> verursachen mehr Schaden, als Garuda in diesem Szenario verursachen würde.
smn.pets.suggestions.titan.content: Titan-Egi sollte nicht in einer Gruppe verwendet werden. Wechsel zu Ifrit-Egi oder zu Garuda-Egi wenn es mehrere magische Fernkämfer sind.
smn.pets.suggestions.titan.why: Zeit in der Titan-Egi verwendet wurde: {titanUptimePercent}%
smn.pets.title: Familiaren
smn.rouse.suggestions.wasted.content: Vermeide es <0/> zu benutzen, wenn du innerhalb von {0} zu einem anderen Egi wechseln oder Bahamut beschwören möchtest. Du verlierst den Schadensbonus von Aufmuntern in dem Moment, indem dein altes Egi verschwindet.
smn.ruin-ii.suggestions.issues.content: <0/> ist ein Schadensverlust wenn es nicht genutzt wird um oGCDs oder PROCs zu weben <1/>. Priorisiere <2/>.
smn.ruin-ii.suggestions.issues.why: {0} Attacke-Wert durch {issues} {issues, plural, one {unnötiges} other {unnötig}} Ruinra {issues, plural, one {Aktivierung} other {Aktivierungen}} verloren.
smn.ruin-ii.suggestions.warnings.content: Benutze <0/> nicht um dich anders zu positionieren, sonder nur, wenn es wegen einer Mechanik nicht anders geht. Die meisten Umpositionierungen können durch "Slidecasting" und durch die erhöhte Mobilität von <1/> gemacht werden.
smn.ruin-ii.suggestions.warnings.why: {0} Attacke-Wert durch {warnings} Ruinra {warnings, plural, one {Aktivierung} other {Aktivierungen}} nur für Bewegung verloren.
smn.ruin-iv.suggestions.overage.content: Benutze <0/> so schnell wie möglich um keine zusätzlichen Procs von <1/> zu verpassen.
smn.ruin-iv.suggestions.overage.why: Verbessertes Ruinra für {0} länger nicht eingesetzt als empfohlen.
smn.ruin-iv.title: Ruinka
smn.shadow-flare.suggestions.missed-tick: Stelle sicher, dass du <0/> so plazierst, dass es für die volle Dauer schaden verursachen kann oder dass es mehrere Ziele trifft.
{missedTicks, plural, one {# missed tick} other {# missed ticks}} von Schattenflamme.
smn.shadow-flare.title: Schattenflamme
war.about.description.warning: While the analysis below should be reasonably accurate, this system is still in development, and may get a little mixed up sometimes. If you notice any issues, or have any concerns, please drop by our Discord channel.
war.gauge.suggestions.lost-rage.content: You used <0/>, <1/>, <2/>, or any gauge generators in a way that overcapped you.
war.gauge.suggestions.lost-rage.why: {0} rage wasted by using abilities that sent you over the cap.
war.gauge.title: war.gauge.title
war.ir.suggestions.badgcd.content: {badGcds} incorrect {badGcds, plural, one {GCD} other {GCDs}} used during IR.`,
war.ir.suggestions.badgcd.why: GCDs used during Inner Release should be limited to <0/> for optimal damage, or  <1/> in AoE situations.
war.ir.suggestions.missedgcd.content: {0} {1, plural, one {GCD} other {GCDs}} missed inside of IR.
war.ir.suggestions.missedgcd.why: {0} {1, plural, one {GCD} other {GCDs}} inside of Inner Release. You should be hitting 5 GCDs per cast. If you can't hit 5 GCDs, consider adjusting your gearset for it.
war.ir.suggestions.onslaught.content: {0} {1, plural, one {Onslaught} other {Onslaughts}} weren't inside of IR.
war.ir.suggestions.onslaught.why: {0} {1, plural, one {Onslaught} other {Onslaughts}} inside of Inner Release. You must hit one Onslaught inside of each Inner Release.
war.ir.suggestions.upheaval.content: {0} {1, plural, one {Upheaval} other {Upheavals}} weren't inside of IR.
war.ir.suggestions.upheaval.why: {0} {1, plural, one {Upheaval} other {Upheavals}} inside of Inner Release. You must hit one Upheaval inside of each Inner Release.
war.ir.title: war.ir.title
war.stormseye.checklist.description: Sturmbrecher erhöht deinen Schaden um 10% und trägt maßgeblich zum Schaden des Kriegers bei.
war.stormseye.checklist.name: Halte Sturmbrecher aktiv
war.suggestions.stormseye.content: Avoid refreshing {0} significantly before its expiration -- That might be making you possibly lose <0/> uses.
war.suggestions.stormseye.why: {0} reapplications that were {1} or more seconds before expiration.
whm.about.description.devwarning: The WHM module is still in a very early developement stage.  If you notice any issues, or have any concerns, or suggestions on what you would like this module to analyze next, please drop by our Discord channel!
whm.about.description.invulnwarning: Currently, for all healers, boss invulnerability checking doesn't function properly. This results in inaccuracy for many time-related functions such as the Always be casting checklist item or DoT uptime.
whm.about.description.support: Currently this module can track DoT uptime, detect clipping and report about missed Divine Benison and Assize casts.
whm.assize.checklist.description: Frequent use of <0/> is typically a DPS gain and helps with MP management.
whm.benison.suggestion.content: Use <0/> more frequently. Frequent uses can mitigate a large amount of damage over the course of a fight, potentially resulting in less required healing GCDs.
whm.benison.suggestion.why: About {_usesMissed} uses of <0/> were missed by holding it for at least a total of {0}.
whm.dots.requirement.uptime-a2.name: Gesamtanwendungszeit von <0/>
whm.dots.requirement.uptime-a3.name: Gesamtanwendungszeit von <0/>
whm.dots.rule.description: DoTs sind eine große Portion deines kontinuierlichen Schadens als Weißmagier. Versuche sie immer aufrecht zu halten.
whm.dots.rule.name: Halte deine DoTs aufrecht
whm.dots.suggestion.clip-a2.content: Avoid refreshing DoTs significantly before their expiration, this will allow you to cast more Stone IV. (Note: We do not yet consider using Aero II for initial damage on the move)
whm.dots.suggestion.clip-a2.why: {0} von {1} durch zu frühes Reaktivieren verloren.
whm.dots.suggestion.clip-a3.content: Avoid refreshing DoTs significantly before their expiration, this will allow you to cast more Stone IV.
whm.dots.suggestion.clip-a3.why: {0} von {1} durch zu frühes Reaktivieren verloren.
whm.overheal.rule.description: Avoid wasting heals by healing for more than required to fill a target's HP bar. While some overheal is inevitable, overheal only serves to generate more enmity, for no gain. Being efficient with healing additionally helps with your MP management.
whm.overheal.rule.name: Avoid overheal
